instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display Problems <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Hi. I have this machine that a shop technician forced the LCD cable in crooked and broke a piece off in the LCD connector. I have change the LCD connector and tried with known working LCD/cable with the same result. Sorry for not leaving any measurements. I had to leave early and wanted to ask in your experience is this repairable? Thank you in advance.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display Problems <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Never seen a resolution issue like that. Did you do a PRAM reset? Tested with a known good LCD? 
Also when this is back running take it to Apple for a new LCD under the coating recall.
